intro: Erythraea centaurium subsp. capitata, commonly known as the red centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its compact, sparsely branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that are typically arranged in a dense, head-like inflorescence, giving it its subspecific name "capitata." It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
